required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Aerosol Particle Concentrations Among Different Oxygen Devices for Spontaneous Breathing Patients With Tracheostomy
clinical_study.official_title: Aerosol Particle Concentrations Among Different Oxygen Devices for Spontaneous Breathing Patients With Tracheostomy: a Randomized Cross-over Trial

brief_summary.textblock: For spontaneous breathing patients with tracheostomy, whose lower airway is directly opened to the room air, the aerosol particles generated by the patients would be directly dispersed into the room air, which might be an direct resource of virus transmission. However, the transmission risk has not been evaluated and the appropriate humidification therapy is unknown. Thus this study is aimed to investigate the aerosol particle concentrations among different oxygen devices for spontaneous breathing patients with tracheostomy, in order to reflect the transmission risk.

detailed_description.textblock: The transmission route of the SARS-CoV-2 virus remains controversial, and concerns persist of potentially increased virus transmission when utilizing high-flow devices and aerosol devices among COVID-19 patients. For spontaneous breathing patients with tracheostomy, whose lower airway is directly opened to the room air, the aerosol particles generated by the patients would be directly dispersed into the room air, which might be an direct resource of virus transmission. However, the transmission risk of tracheostomy during spontaneous breathing has not been evaluated and the appropriate humidification therapy is unknown. Thus this study is aimed to investigate the aerosol particle concentrations among different oxygen devices for spontaneous breathing patients with tracheostomy, in order to reflect the transmission risk.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: five oxygen and humidification different devices will be used for the enrolled patients, with 5 minutes each. Aerosol particle concentrations at 1 foot and 3 feet away from the patients will be measured.
study_design_info.masking_description: the device utilized in the study will be labeled as 1,2,3,4 and 5, the investigator who performed the statistical analysis will be blinded for the device

primary_outcome.measure: aerosol particle concentrations at 1 foot away from patient
primary_outcome.description: aerosol particle concentrations at 1 foot away from patient

primary_outcome.measure: aerosol particle concentrations at 3 feet away from patient
primary_outcome.description: aerosol particle concentrations at 3 feet away from patient

secondary_outcome.measure: patient comfort with different oxygen devices
secondary_outcome.description: patients would scale their comfort at a 5-point Likert scale

arm_group.arm_group_label: high-flow high humidity oxygen device with tracheostomy adapter
arm_group.description: This device provides high-flow gas to tracheostomy patients with heat and humidification. A special adapter is used to connect the tracheostomy tube and circuit.

arm_group.arm_group_label: large-volume nebulizer (cool aerosol) with trach collar
arm_group.description: This device is the conventional device that is commonly utilized to provide humidification for spontaneous breathing patients with tracheostomy.
This device did not provide any humidification but only oxygen

arm_group.arm_group_label: large-volume nebulizer (cool aerosol) with T-piece and a filter
arm_group.description: this device is added with a filter, in order to reduce aerosol particle concentrations in the surrounding environment

arm_group.arm_group_label: high-flow high humidity device with a scavenger or a surgical mask
arm_group.description: this device is added with a scavenger or a surgical mask over the adapter, in order to reduce aerosol particle concentrations in the surrounding environment

intervention.intervention_name: high-flow high humidity oxygen device with tracheostomy adapter
intervention.description: This device can provide heat and humidified gas for spontaneous breathing patients with tracheostomy at a high gas flow rate.
intervention.arm_group_label: high-flow high humidity device with a scavenger or a surgical mask
high-flow high humidity oxygen device with tracheostomy adapter
large-volume nebulizer (cool aerosol) with T-piece and a filter
large-volume nebulizer (cool aerosol) with trach collar

patient_data.ipd_description: Data are available upon reasonable request. Proposals should be directed to the corresponding author
